column1: Limb plethysmography is a test that compares blood pressure in the legs and arms.
This test may be done in the health care provider's office or in a hospital.
The health care provider inflates the cuffs, and a machine called a plethysmograph measures the pulses from each cuff.
This test is most often done to check for narrowing or blockages of blood vessels (arteries) in the arms or legs.
